forecast.review: Both forecasters emphasize the unprecedented international venue for a presidential UFC appearance and the short interval since Trump’s Miami attendance. I agree those are the dominant factors. Their use of Rogan’s refusal to go to Canada is, at best, a weak directional signal, but it does align with the broader optics/logistics challenges. They also stress the lack of historical precedent for any president attending a UFC event abroad, which I weighted already but agree merits heavy emphasis given 12 days with no credible travel signals.
forecast.rationale: My prior 8% leaned on proximity (Montreal is close to Trump’s usual bases) and his strong Dana White relationship. On reflection, the combination of (1) international travel as a sitting president for a non-official purpose, (2) no historical precedent, (3) the very recent April attendance (making back-to-back numbered cards within a month atypical), and (4) no current reporting or preparatory signals this close to the event collectively argues for a lower probability. I’m trimming to 5%. I would move up on credible reports of a Canada trip or signals from the White House/UFC/Dana White indicating attendance; I’d move down with a conflicting public schedule or explicit denials.
